intro: Kirganelia puberula, commonly known as the hairy kirganelia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters, often during the rainy season. Its leaves are typically hairy and ovate, contributing to its common name. Kirganelia puberula is often found in open woodlands and along riverbanks, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
